Description: Terracotta figure of woman standing with arms at her sides. Fragment of upper part of a female figure, including head. Made from a wheel-made tube with added mould-made head, headdress and hand-made arms. She wears a large stephane. Eyes not indicated. Possibly naked, though this is not clear. Very crude work. Arms and stephane added separately. Lower part broken and lost. Coarse red fabric.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Identified in Edgars unpublished notes as a locally produced Ptolemaic figure. However parallels from Cyprus suggest a Cypriot or Levantine Archaic construction.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.128) (Phase 3)
